name: Dream South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Palmer House was perfect for our needs -- prime location one block from the beach, very clean room with modern décor, friendly staff, and a reasonable price compared to other SoBe hotels. The funky mood lighting in the room was a bonus! Beware the scammy restaurants on Ocean Drive offering drink specials with prices "subject to change without notice." We enjoyed Puerto Sangua (fried pork chunks -- mmm), Alma Mexicana (awesomely fresh tacos), and Spiga (cozy Italian restaurant one block from the hotel).
reviews.title: Exactly as Advertised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous boutique hotel in great location. Staff especially concierge extremely helpful. Rooms modern and clean and although it lacked a bit of natural light we loved the funky lighting system (once we figured out how to use it!!)
reviews.title: Miami chic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would not hesitate to stay here again if we return to Miami.
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautifully designed rooms, clean, comfortable, excellent and friendly staff, great location. Despite being right on Collins Avenue, there is minimal noise that comes in from outside, although a little warning that the bedroom walls are a bit on the thin side, so it is not difficult to overhear your neighbours. Also, some of the design is not great functionally - for example, you have to get out of bed to turn off the bedside light. But, unless you are unfortunate enough to have really loud people in the room next door, these points are fairly minor and I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends
reviews.title: Great location, staff and rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel in september for a week and it really was a pleasure. I was expecting the rooms to be quite small from the photos that we had seen but they are actually larger than the photos depict and more than adequate for a short stay in miami. I really loved the decor in the hotel and the lighting in the room was really unique. The hotel has a great location on Collins avenue and is only a couple of minutes from the beach. The staff in the hotel are so friendly and helpful and provide sun chairs to take to the beach and beach towels which was great. I think the hotel were building a pool when we were there so it will be even better when this is complete. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to a friend and would stay again if returning to Miami.
reviews.title: the price was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were barely here, just stayed one night on a layover after 2 weeks in Ecuador.
reviews.title: Comfortable beds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: The rooms look just like the website, and I didn't think they were too small (I had just spent over a week on a sailboat, though).
reviews.title: Exellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: "special"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I could never figure out how to open the blinds, so I'm not sure what the view was, but I didn't hear any club music like other reviewers mentioned.
reviews.title: Trendy Hotel... Great Location... Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have never been to Miami, and from what I saw, it might never be a vacation destination for me, but if I happen to be that way again, I think the price would bring me back to the Palmer House, and the decor would bring my husband back.
reviews.title: Great Staff, great location, stylish and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of an airline miles redemption situation, we found ourselves needing to stay overnight in Miami. I booked a room at the Palmer House South Beach disregarding "the dude's" recommendation of The Standard Hotel. I'd never been to Miami, and with only one night's stay planned, I wanted to immerse myself in the art deco district as much as possible. The Palmer House didn't disappoint. I only wish we could've stayed longer. The room — albeit small — was beautifully decorated and appealed to my appreciation for modern decor. I will say that the lighting system is a bit tricky at first (the light switches are buttons with graphics to indicate their function). The dude and I both work in the tech industry, and we've adapted to icon use in gadgetry. So we figured the system out on our own. Alternatively, the hotel staff is happy to show you how it works. My only real gripe with the room is the lack of a towel bar by the shower. There's a metal hook on the wall opposite the shower, but it's far too small to properly accommodate a bath towel, and you can only hang one towel on it (if there are two people in a room and two damp towels, what then?). The bed was very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful Modern Decor. Great Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is beautifully decorated. The lights are so cool! Great location - walking distance to everything including the beach. The staff was excellent. The lighting can be a little dim. The rooms are on the small side. The hotel is expanding into a building next door. There could be some construction noise. We were there over a weekend and did not hear any noise. The pool is not done yet.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in the Heart of Miami South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I were laying over in Miami for one night on our Honeymoon. Palmer House was a great finish to the amazing trip.
reviews.title: Trendy, Relaxed, Comfortable, Affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Staff was very helpful, giving us a quiet high room upon request. They showed us how to work the light switches and offered to help us find places to eat, shop, etc.
reviews.title: Location and hotel staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel was Clean, Quiet, Comfortable and really, really funky. The chandelier and shower being my favourite pieces.
reviews.title: Designed to Within an Inch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first arrived I was a big grump, for this I apologize profusely. The staff didnt flinch a bit and was very sweet.
reviews.title: Exactly what we needed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Drove down to SOBE from Palm Coast for a little R&R with my wife and cousins. The rooms were spotless (I'm talking hospital clean and no critters at all), the staff very friendly and helpful, the location cant be beat. There's nothing bad to say at all. The bed was super comfy (and I'm a large woman with arthritis in my hip). The sheets were soft but not grabby. Loved the mattress. Want one at home.
reviews.title: Very Good Spot !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There was a little closet over the safe to put your things, and hangers that actually come off!! A couple of drawers were in there too. The safe is more than big enough for two laptops.
reviews.title: Perfect Location and A Good Nights Sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lighting was cool, I found it easy to use. I could read in bed using the little spotlight lamp that was sticking up off of the headboard. The shower was amazing!! Hot, plenty of pressure, and SEXY! The toilet was interesting...maybe frost the glass? Alone with my wife it was cool but no one could stop by our room if someone was in there. Didn't really bother us, it was just something to laugh over (knock knock, OH don't come in she's in the toilet room tee hee).
reviews.title: Perfect for a quick trip to South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The concierge helped us with no problem for our valet parking and for booking the tour of Miami we took.
reviews.title: Great hotel in almost all respects

aka: Dream South Beach Hotel Miami Beach
description: Dream is a fashionable Art Deco-inspired paradise located in the heart of South Beach. Our hotel is surrounded by stylish boutiques, the hottest clubs and is just 50 yards from pristine white sand beaches. Right next door is another fashionable address, Villa by Barton G., once known as the famed Versace Mansion Casa Casuarina.Art Deco style meets French Moroccan chic at our South Beach luxury hotel, boasting 108 guestrooms and suites designed by Michael Czysz with modern amenities such as large flat screen TVs, high-speed Wi-Fi, fully-stocked minibars, Etro bath amenities and much more. While here, be immersed in late 70’s poolside glamour at our rooftop pool and lounge, indulge in Northern Italian fare at Serafina Dream South Beach, slip into ecstasy with a relaxing spa treatment at Shala Spa, and enjoy an atmosphere that is both cosmopolitan and comfortable.
